project_abstract.cdata: The West Africa Regional Biosafety Project is part of the West African Economic and Monetary Union (WAEMU) Regional Program for Biosafety, adopted in 2007. The project is funded through two main instruments: a Global Environment Fund (GEF) Trust Fund (TF091199) which supports the Recipient for the establishment of an operational institutional, legal and regulatory regional bio-safety framework for the regulation of living modified organisms and an International Development Agency (IDA) Credit to Burkina Faso (Cr. 4368-BUR) which supports  the West African Economic and Monetary Union for the establishment of an operational institutional, legal and regulatory regional bio-safety framework for the regulation of living modified organisms. Both instruments were submitted to Board as one project, a fully blended GEF/IDA operation, sharing a common Project Development Objective (PDO). This Restructuring Paper outlines changes to be made to both the GEF (TF091199) and IDA (Cr. 4368-BUR) legal agreements. In specific, it proposes the following changes: (i) the amendment of the PDO and PDO Level Results Indicator to reflect a more realistic objective taking into account current level of implementation and time left before closing date; (ii) introduction of changes in the description of the three project components in support of the revised PDO and in accordance with the recommendations of the MTR; (iii) reallocation of GEF Trust Fund and IDA Credit proceeds; and (iv) addition of a Goods category to the list of categories of Eligible Expenditures in the GEF Grant Agreement mainly for the purchase of equipments for eligible Member States national bio-safety laboratories.

P096058.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectName>Projet régional de biosécurité en Afrique de l’Ouest</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>Le Projet régional ouest-africain de biosécurité du Burkina Faso a pour but de protéger la biodiversité régionale contre les risques potentiels liés à l’introduction des organismes vivants modifiés (OVM) dans l’environnement. Le projet comprend trois composantes : a) adapter et diffuser des méthodologies régionales afin d’évaluer et de gérer les risques que comportent les organismes modifiés pour la biosécurité ; b) mettre en place un cadre institutionnel, juridique et réglementaire régional relatif à la biosécurité ; et c) mettre en place le cadre institutionnel, juridique et réglementaire relatif à la biosécurité dans les États membres de l’UEMOA qui ont ratifié le Protocole de Carthagène, en mettant initialement l’accent sur un certain nombre de produits.</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
